alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 22 at 10:17AM PDT until April 26 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Comus affecting Humboldt County zone. .Warm temperatures may melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Comus. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Minor lowland flooding throughout the reach. No flooding in Winnemucca. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Monday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Humboldt River Comus 9.5 8.2 Sat 9 am PDT 9.1 9.5 9.5 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 1015 AM PDT.
